subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] QS news update Nov 25
msgSnippet: I agree heartily with Ted. Paige
messageBody:
I agree heartily with Ted.

Paige

Ted Larson Freeman wrote:

Hi Paul,

Yes, it's nice to experiment. I have to say that I find it odd to
start reading the news and immediately find the word 'return' spelled
'Roar,Eat,Tut, Roar,Nun' .

It seems to me that the scale of the solution should match the scale
of the problem. I think this is a minor readability issue which will
probably go away naturally with continued reading practice, and it can
be solved quite easily with the guideline I've just suggested of not
connecting 'Ado' to 'Roar' in words such as 'arrest'.

Ted

On Nov 24, 2007 10:22 PM, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@iglou. com> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> I have changed the dictionary that converts the QS news. You will notice
> that the combination that was formerly Ado Roar is now just plain Roar.
> So the word "utter" should not appear as:
>
> Ado Tut Roar
>
> I made this change to test out a new way of handling the ambiguous
> combination of "ar," when forming the sound in "bird" or "nurse." We had
> situation in which the word "arrest" and "urban" both started with Ado
> Roar, but each had a very different sound. Anthony has made a suggestion
> to simply get rid of the vowel before the "r" in words like "urban," but
> to keep it for words like "arrest."
>
> This is just an experiment as we try to work out a solution, so let me
> know any difficulties you have, and what you think.
>
> Paul
>
